alert.note: Alert for Broome (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 11:09PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected for Choconut Creek. * WHERE...Portions of central New York and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in central New York, Broome. In northeast Pennsylvania, Susquehanna. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Minor flooding of Choconut Creek is expected. This includes Richards Avenue Park, Vestal Center Park, and water may also reach backyards of residences closest to the Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1103 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain during the past several hours. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of only up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area, but creeks are continuing to respond to earlier rainfall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vestal and Vestal Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
